newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent quotes down on bearish U.S. oil data.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent quotes down on bearish U.S. oil data.

text.p: SIMEX Brent crude was quoted lower from Tuesday's close on bearish American Petroleum Institute (API) figures, brokers said at midday on Wednesday.
Latest API figures showed that crude oil stocks have risen by nearly 3 million barrels, distillates by 2.6 million barrels and gasoline a hefty 3.6 million barrels.
"The market is reflecting the API figures," said a broker.
June Brent was last quoted at $17.80/$18.04, lower from its last close on London's IPE Brent at $18.14. July was last quoted aty $18.15/$18.20.
"Technically, the market is weak," said another broker.
He asssessed June support on SIMEX at $17.90 a barrel.
NYMEX crude on ACCESS was last traded at $19.55 per barrel down 28 cents from its last official close.
